intro: Pentaschistis pungens, commonly known as the spiny pungent bladder, is a member of the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils. It has a taproot system and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
